channel.title: Bit of help

item.title: Bit of help
item.dc:creator: @slavemaster veer
item.description:
@slavemaster wrote:

Inflater.inflate() takes the output buffer where it writes the decompressed, /inflated/ data. The output buffer here has a size of an_int_0… it should be very clear.

Read full topic

item.title: Bit of help
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

What is an Inflater? I think an_int_0 is the decompressed size.
Oops, I accidentally deleted my post (assumed you were talking about a class in the client).

Well now that you linked me to it, isn’t is a bit obvious? an_int_0 is the compressed size since inflate(byte[]) accepts a compressed buffer as its parameter.

Read full topic

item.title: Bit of help
item.dc:creator: @cookies222 cookies222
item.description:
@cookies222 wrote:

		if (class_f.an_int_1 != class_f.an_int_0) {
		    byte[] buffer = new byte[class_f.an_int_0];
		    Inflater inflater = new Inflater(true);
		    inflater.setInput(input);
		    inflater.inflate(buffer);
		    input = buffer;
		}

is int_1 or int_0 compressed size?

Read full topic
